fr.sorbonne_u.components.plugins.dipc.interfaces

Interface PushControlImplementationI

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    PushControlI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataInterfacePushControlClientSidePlugin, DataInterfacesPushControlServerSidePlugin, PushControlConnector, PushControlInboundPort, PushControlOutboundPort

    public interface PushControlImplementationI
    The interface PushControlImplementationI declares basic component services to control the regular exchanges of data via a DataOfferedI interface in push mode.

    Description

    The interface defines the services to start and stop the pushing of data. The two start methods allow either to perform a fixed or an unbounded number of pushes with a specified interval of time between each. The stop service stops the pushes that were previously started. If an unbounded number of pushes have been started, the stop service is the only way to stop them, but stop can also be used to stop a fixed number of pushes before the end.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2018-01-26

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      boolean currentlyPushesData(java.lang.String portURI)
      return true if a series of pushes are done on the port.
      boolean isPortExisting(java.lang.String portURI)
      return true if the owner component has a data offered inbound port of the given URI.
      void startLimitedPushing(java.lang.String portURI, long interval, int n)
      start, after interval period of time, n pushes of data and force the pushes to be done each interval period of time.
      void startUnlimitedPushing(java.lang.String portURI, long interval)
      start, after interval period of time, the pushing of data and force the pushes to be done indefinitely each interval period of time.
      void stopPushing(java.lang.String portURI)
      stop the pushing of data on the given port.
